article.class: fpost post-number-1 post-83 page type-page status-publish hentry

h2.span: Miami-Yoder School Closure Extended to May 20, 2020

div.p: Today, with the support of our Board of Education, we have made a difficult yet important decision to continue with our remote learning plan for the remainder of the 2019 – 2020 school year.

p.strong: Please see our Announcement for full details on food service, remote learning, alternative form of graduation, and retrieval of student belongings from the school.

li.a: Remote Learning to Continue for Remainder of 2019-20 School Year
Spring 2020 events Canceled per COVID-19 Protocols

a.title: 33 National Park Tours you can take virtually from home

li.a: 33 National Park Tours you can take virtually from home

div.h3: Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment (CDPHE)
div.p: Miami-Yoder School District is a small, rural school district located approximately 38 miles east of Colorado Springs, Colorado. We serve a Pre-School through 12th grade population of approximately 316 students in three schools: Elementary (P-5), Middle School (6-8), and High School (9-12).

Miami-Yoder School District is a partnership of professionals, parents, and community members dedicated to providing a rigorous, challenging curriculum in a positive environment, giving opportunities which foster and encourage individuals to be successful, productive, citizens.

li.a: Family and Community Guides to Academic Standards
Remote Learning to Continue for Remainder of 2019-20 School Year
Spring 2020 events Canceled per COVID-19 Protocols
Counselor’s Corner – Resources for Parents & Students
All Pikes Peak schools will be closed from March 16 to March 27
